The coefficient q relates the indices of abundance ( O t) to the population size ( O t = q * N t). We had no information about this value. Therefore, we built an uninformative prior according to a uniform distribution
U ( 0.000001 , 0.001 )
. The limits of the distribution were set using plausible values gauged by comparing the estimated priors of carrying capacity and the O t. We used a range that would have underlined populations from a few thousand to millions of sharks.
